lines.text: With your nerve, I'd hate to have a tooth pulled.
Hey, Steve, that brooch is as phony as a mother-in-law's kiss.
What do I get paid off in?
Nice pictures of Washington and Lincoln with numbers on them - big numbers!

[referring to her bad luck at the roulette table]
All my rabbits have flat feet!

[smelling one of Gordon's cigar]
It's a good cigar. Hasn't got that awful smell of tobacco.

[when she notices Shayne is reluctant to take off his shirt and bare his chest in front of her]
Go on, young man. I used to be an art student.

[in a courtly manner]
The cops, Madam!
Well, it may be a case to you, but it's all goulash to me!
When I was young - I mean a little younger - in New York I played Madame Butterfly.
You did?
Mmmm-hmmm.
What race?
When are you gonna start talking straight?
Not until my attorney gets out of law school!

[arriving to find Shayne at the murder scene]
Shayne? What are you doing here?
Ask me later. I haven't thought of an answer yet.

It was the great piano mystery. The body was found under the piano, his throat was strangled with piano wires, the soft pedal was found imbedded in his neck, and somebody had completely severed the head from the body. He was dead!

[dryly]
Oh, suicide, hmmm?

[as Shayne returns to the mansion after being knocked unconscious]
What happened to you?
I tore my pants.
Your head! What'd you do to it?
It was open by mistake.

[admiring the large mansion]
Quite a little nest you have here, Ponsby!
Yes, sir. We think it rather cozy.
Cozy, heh!
[laughs]
I'll bet if you walk in your sleep, you need a bicycle.
